text: [Music]
hello i am damini
a cloud support engineer here at the aws
office in bangalore
today i'm going to show you how users
can use a single
ssh key pair for all their aws regions
let's get started to use a single ssh
key pair
for all your aws regions first generate
a public ssh key
from a private ssh key then import the
key into each of your aws regions
if you don't have one already begin by
creating an ssh key pair
for linux first generate a public ssh
key file
from a private ssh key file
note replace my key pair name with the
name of your private pam file
make sure you are working on a bash
shell and that
the aws command line interface is
configured with the user
that has valid access run the following
command to set the aws
regions then run the following command
to import the public ssh key into
all the regions
for windows first generate a public ssh
key file from a private ssh key file
open puttygen choose load
to load your private key file
choose save public key
import the public ssh key into the
desired aws regions
by running the following commands note
replace my key pair name with your
public ssh
key file thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
[Music]
aws
